page.title: 19The Lifeboat
page.content: The Clovelly Lifeboat "City of Bristol" is moored approx. 1/4 mile offshore, but goes to Lundy for shelter in bad weather.She is one of the largest of the Royal National Lifeboat Institution's fleet, financed entirely voluntarily. An R.N.L.I. station to cover the Western approaches of the Bristol Channel was first opened at Clovelly in 1870. The boat is 70 ft. long and is the 3rd. of the "Clyde" class to be built - hence its number 70-003. Unlike other lifeboats it is permanently manned by 2 crews of coxwain, mechanic, and 3 deckhands, who live and sleep on board for alternate fortnights, ready to respond immediately to any calls of distress at sea. Financial constraints now make the boat's future uncertain.
